Sun of Faith - English: Chapter 22. Freedom From Austerities
Manual - Tibetan (བོད་ཡིག།): Vol. Ca (5) and vol. Cha (6) pp. 18-19.

Sun of Faith - English: In this way six year of practicing austerities passed. The Bodhisattva reflected: "Though these practices of austeries alone, all those today who wish to overcome sufffering will fail to achieve knowledge or vision, will not be able to touch enlightenment. Earlier I accomplished meditative absorption in the farming village. I would be able to achieve enlightenment in reliance upon that practice, yet in my emaciated and weakened state, I will not be able to produce such a state. I must have strength and vital energy. He relaxed his breathing and ate rice porridge and other solid foods.
Manual - Tibetan (བོད་ཡིག།): དེ་ནས་ཕྱོགས་གཅིག་ཏུ་ཁྲུས་མཛད་ཅིང་། མི་རོ་ལ་དབུ་སྔས་མཛད་དེ་གཟིམས་པ་འབྲི་སྟེ་དཀའ་བ་སྤྱོད་པའི་སྐོར་རོ། །   ༼ཆ༽ དེ་ནས་ཕྱོགས་གཅིག་ཏུ་ཁྲུས་མཛད་པ་དང་། འཁོར་ལྔ་ཀུན་ཏུ་རྒྱུའི་ཆ་བྱད་གཞན་དུ་འགྲོ་བ་དང་། འབྲས་ཆན་གསོལ་བའི་ཚུལ་བྱ། དེ་ནས་བུ་མོ་དགའ་མོ་དང་། དགའ་སྟོབས་མས་འོ་ཐུག་ཕུལ་བ་དང་། གསེར་སྣོད་ཆུ་བོ་ནེ་རཉྫ་ནར་བོར་བ་དང་། དེ་ཀླུས་ཁྱེར་བ་དང་། བརྒྱ་བྱིན་བྱ་ཁྱུང་དུ་སྤྲུལ་ནས་དེ་ཕྲོགས་ཏེ་ལྷ་ཡུལ་དུ་ཁྱེར་བ་དང་།
Manual - English: The Buddha takes a bath. He then sleeps with a corpse as his pillow. [Chapter Cha]: The Buddha takes a bath. The five disciples eat cooked rice. Two girls named Nandā (dga' mo) and Nandabalā (dga' stobs ma) offer milk porridge to the Buddha. The golden bowl gets lost in River Nairañjanā. A nāga collects it, but Indra (brgya byin), in guise of a garuda, steals it and takes it to the realm of gods.

Sun of Faith - English: He rubbed his body with sesame oil and washed it in a gentle stream. At this, the five companions lost confidence in him. "O wise ones," they said, "Gotama has given up the practice of virtue and has fallen. Now he will be unable to gain any result whatsoever."
So they rejected the Bodhisattva and went to Varanasi, where they became known as the Five Ascetics.
Inscription - English: Having rejected the Buddha, the group of five left and went to Varanasi.

Sun of Faith - English: Then the Bodhisattva gradually regained his physical strength, and traveled to Senapuri. The village chief was Sena. He had two daughters, Nanda and Nandabala. Both girls were as perfect as precious jewels.

They had heard that the Bodhisattva would become a unversival monarch, though they had not heard that he was a renunciate. They also heard that if a woman were to practice strict discipline and moral conduct for twelve years, and at the conclusion, were to prepare excellent rice porrage and offer it to a sage worn down through austerities, that women would become the Bodhisattva's wife.

Sun of Faith - Tibetan (བོད་ཡིག།): དེ་དག་གིས་བརྟུལ་ཞུགས་བླངས་ནས་དུས་དེར་ལོ་བཅུ་གཉིས་ཀྱང་རྫོགས་པས། བ་མཆོག་སྟོང་ཡོད་པ་རྣམས་བཞོས་ཏེ། བ་སྟོང་པོ་དེ་ཉིད་ལ་བླུད་དོ། །དེ་རྣམས་བཞོས་ནས་ལྔ་བརྒྱ་ལ་བླུད་དོ། །དེ་ཡང་ལྔ་བརྒྱ་བོ་དེ་ཉིད་ལའོ། །དེ་བཞིན་དུ། ཉིས་བརྒྱ་ལྔ་བཅུ་དང་། བརྒྱ་ཉེར་ལྔ་དང་། དྲུག་ཅུ་རྩ་གསུམ་དང་། སུམ་ཅུ་རྩ་གཉིས་དང་། བཅུ་དྲུག་དང་བརྒྱད་དེ་
Sun of Faith - English: The daughters practiced moral conduct for twelve years. At the conclusion, they milked a thousand of their best cows. Then they fed the milk back to those cows. Then they milked them again and fed the milk to five hundred cows. They did the same for 250, 125, sixty-three, thirty-two, sixteen, and eight cows.

Next, they boiled the condensed milk sixteen times in a crystal vessel. While the milk boiled, the gods of the pure abodes quickly poured in a medicine called "Restorative." Auspicious signs such as wheels, good luck symbols, and swastikas appeared on the surface of the boiling milk. An ascetic named Upajivaka asked for the milk but the girls did not give it.
The next day, they poured the milk from the crystal vessel into a golden bowl. At that point, Indra, in the guise of a brahmin, Brahma, and a god of the pure realms approached.
When the girls began to offer the milk to the Indra in the form of a brahmin, he asked, "Would you offer it to me or to someone greater me?"
"We would offer it to someone greater."
"In that case, offer it to Brahma the Great."

When they began to offer it to Brahma, he again questioned them as before. And when they began to offer it to the god of the pure realms, he too questioned them as before and said, "Offer it to the Bodhisattva."

Then the two girls went to see the Boddhisattva. The bodhisattva was bathing in the Nairanjana River. But his body was weak, so he was not able to get out. The gods bent down the branch of an anjuna tree on the riverbank, and the Bodhisattva grabbed it with his hand and got out of the water. He put on his ascetic's robe and sat on the riverbank. And here the two girls offered milk to him.

"Are you also offering this bowl?" asked the Bodhisattva. 
"Yes," they said.
The Bodhisattva drank the milk, and washed the golden bowl. Then he threw the bowl into the river, where the serpent deities took it.
Indra appeared in the form of a garuda, snatched the bowl from the serpent deities, and carried it to the Heaven of the Thirty-Three where he installed it as a great object of veneration.
Inscription - English: The golden bowl is carried to the abode of the gods.

Sun of Faith - English: Then the Bodhisattva said, "What do you seek with this offering?"
"To become the wives of the Shakya prince, who will become a universal monarch," said the two girls.
"He has already abandonded desires and become a renunciate," said the Bodhisattva.
"Then, may he fulfill all of the aims he is striving for."
So, through just this offering of an excellent milk porridge, his body became strong with a golden tone, just has it had been before.
